This also changes file permissions for some reason.

message:
Fix selection changes when toggling flags or modifying the spinner items.

Note that the removeAdapterItemAt() method is still a bit buggy when removing the selected item, as the onItemSelected callback will not always get called correctly in that case.

title: Release 1.2 to maven, including support for min/max date and overridable styles.
message: Release 1.2 to maven, including support for min/max date and overridable styles.

title: Workaround for setVisibility temporary selection bug.
message:
Workaround for setVisibility temporary selection bug.

When rotating the device with FLAG_HIDE_TIME set and a temporary item selected, the footer would be selected after clicking on the time button. It turns out the system somehow manages to get rid of the temporary selection after the Spinner is made visible.

title: Dependency updates and README simplification
message: Dependency updates and README simplification

title: Set minimum spinner height to 48dp, fixing #25.
message:
Set minimum spinner height to 48dp, fixing #25.

This guarantees that the spinners always have the minimum touch target size of 48 dips.

title: Add min/max date calls to ReminderDatePicker and documentation updates
message: Add min/max date calls to ReminderDatePicker and documentation updates

title: Add disabled spinner items and support for min/max date.
message:
Add disabled spinner items and support for min/max date.

If FLAG_PAST is not set, the minimum date is now set to today per default. Also includes a couple of small fixes and annotations.

title: Switch to jaydeep17's DateTimePicker, updates and fixes.
message:
Switch to jaydeep17's DateTimePicker, updates and fixes.

As flavienlaurent's repo is currently inactive we'll use the forked picker instead as that adds some important color and layout changes. The setNotifyOnChanged(false) in PickerSpinner was something I experimented with and then forgot to remove. It stopped the spinner selected spinner item from updating when changing flags.

title: Fix ClassCastException in getSelectedDate (#19).
message:
Fix ClassCastException in getSelectedDate (#19).

This is more like a workaround so the onItemSelected callback will now be ignored when the footer is selected.
I also moved the last selected date checks into the date and time spinners, so that redundant onItemSelected calls are ignored when one of the spinners is used without the full ReminderDatePicker.

title: Fix onDateSelected not fired in Android 5.1 (#20).
message:
Fix onDateSelected not fired in Android 5.1 (#20).

It's nicer like this anyway, as it doesn't rely on the platform calling onItemSelected in the right order.
Also cleaned up a bit (recycling those TypedArrays... )

title: Updated README - fixed image sizes and spelling.
message: Updated README - fixed image sizes and spelling.

title: Enable FLAG_NUMBERS for the DateSpinner's weekdays.
message:
Enable FLAG_NUMBERS for the DateSpinner's weekdays.

When FLAG_NUMBERS and FLAG_WEEKDAY_NAMES are used together, the spinner now shows the date as secondary text next to the weekday name.
Note that in rare occasions the secondary date will be cut off under the spinner arrow as the spinner is not wide enough.
This happens because the PickerSpinnerAdapter cannot measure temporary items when the spinner size is evaluated.

title: Fix bug #16: Time items are restored correctly now.
message: Fix bug #16: Time items are restored correctly now.

title: Add methods to control date format as discussed in #15.
message:
Add methods to control date format as discussed in #15.

The setDateFormat and getCustomDateFormat methods are similar to their time counterparts, except that getCustomDateFormat will return null when no custom format has been set before.

title: Fix issue #15 with new FLAG_WEEKDAY_NAMES.
message:
Fix issue #15 with new FLAG_WEEKDAY_NAMES.

When a date within the next week is selected, the weekday name will now be shown when the new flag is set. Otherwise, it will be displayed using the default date format as the spinner in Google Keep does.

title: Release 1.1.3 to maven central, containing bugfixes
message: Release 1.1.3 to maven central, containing bugfixes

title: Fix bug #13 and correct setTimeFormat method.
message:
Fix bug #13 and correct setTimeFormat method.

The selected time would just get overriden by the default date in onAttachToWindow().
The setTimeFormat() works now as expected, it would occasionally crash when a temporary item was selected.

title: Fix bug #11 and update ABC to version 21.0.3
message:
Fix bug #11 and update ABC to version 21.0.3

The flags in the TimeSpinner are now correctly restored when calling setTimeFormat().

title: Release 1.1.2 to maven fixing 12/24 hours format and built with gradle 1.0
message: Release 1.1.2 to maven fixing 12/24 hours format and built with gradle 1.0

title: Fix issue #9 and simplify time strings.
message:
Fix issue #9 and simplify time strings.

The TimeSpinner now correctly uses the 12-hour format if set by the system. Declaring the time format (hh:mm) in the time strings was a bad idea to begin with, so that has been moved into the code.

title: Use exact version numbers for dependencies
message:
Use exact version numbers for dependencies

Mavens POM check gave me some errors when using '.+' declarations in gradle version numbers, it is probably safer like this anyway.

title: Release 1.1.1 to maven central, allows controlling time format
message: Release 1.1.1 to maven central, allows controlling time format

title: Add methods to control time format as requested in #9
message:
Add methods to control time format as requested in #9

Allows setting the time format used in the TimeSpinner so you can use a format specific to your app passing a java.text.SimpleDateFormat to setTimeFormat().

title: Release 1.1.0 to maven, targeting Android Lollipop.
message:
Release 1.1.0 to maven, targeting Android Lollipop.

You can stick to version 1.0.+ if you're not developing for Lollipop yet.

title: Update target SDK and AppCompat to Android Lollipop.
message:
Update target SDK and AppCompat to Android Lollipop.

Had a huge issue with AppCompat 21 on KitKat using the dark theme, because the spinner dropdown menu background is white and not black as it is on Lollipop.
I worked around this by inversing the text color in dark themes.
Note that the spinner background arrow drawable is white on pre-Lollipop (even in lite theme) and looks kind of ugly, but I don't see any way around that as it is an issue in AppCompat.

title: Add project.properties and update README with better Eclipse support.
message:
Add project.properties and update README with better Eclipse support.

This fixes issue #8, even though importing it into Eclipse is still a mess because of the 2 needed additional libraries.

Use separate string for last/next weekend days to allow gender variation.

For now, this is the lazy and faster way.

This is not implemented everywhere for performance reasons (getSelectedDate isn't the fastest method in the world).

title: Rewrite Adapter and Android Studio updates
message:
Rewrite Adapter and Android Studio updates

PickerSpinnerAdapter doesn't make use of the super.getView and getDropdownView any more. Works perfectly now, only need to finalize the twin_text_item and twin_text_dropdown_item with the correct layout and text markups.
Updated Android Studio to 0.8.1 beta, but still running on old SDK and build tools (v19) until they are stable.
